sparkmaster: String = spark://Kennys-MBP:7077

paragraphs.text:
%md 

## Spark Dataset vs Dataframe


Since Spark 2.0, DataSet was introduced to be a more general data processing structure compared to DataFrame. `DataFrame` in Spark is an alias of `DataSet[Row]`.

Recall that

msg.data:
Spark Dataset vs Dataframe

Since Spark 2.0, DataSet was introduced to be a more general data processing structure compared to DataFrame. DataFrame in Spark is an alias of DataSet[Row].

Recall that

paragraphs.text:
val df:DataFrame = sparkSession.read
    .option("header", "true")
    .option("delimiter",",")
    .option("inferSchema", "true")
    .csv(hadoopmaster + "/data/Covid-19-SG.csv")
    
df.show(5)

%md 
We can give a much more precise type schema to the structured data

msg.data: We can give a much more precise type schema to the structured data

paragraphs.text:
import spark.implicits._


case class Record (date:java.sql.Timestamp, dailyConfirmed:Int, dailyDischarged:Int, dischargedToIsolation:Int, dailyDeaths:Int, testedPositiveDemise:Int, dailyImported:Int, dailyLocalTransimission:Int, localCasesResidingInDorms:Option[Int], localCasesNotResidinginDorms:Option[Int])


val fmt = new java.text.SimpleDateFormat("dd-MMM-yyyy")

def parse(row:Row):Record = {
    val date = new java.sql.Timestamp(fmt.parse(row(0).toString + "-2020").getTime)
    val dailyConfirmed = row(1).toString.toInt
    val dailyDischarged = row(2).toString.toInt
    val dischargedToIsolation = row(3).toString.toInt
    val dailyDeaths = row(4).toString.toInt
    val testedPositiveDemise = row(5).toString.toInt
    val dailyImported = row(6).toString.toInt
    val dailyLocalTransimission = row(7).toString.toInt
    val localCasesResidingInDorms = Try(row(8).toString.toInt).toOption
    val localCasesNotResidinginDorms = Try(row(9).toString.toInt).toOption
    Record(date,dailyConfirmed, dailyDischarged, dischargedToIsolation, dailyDeaths, testedPositiveDemise, dailyImported, dailyLocalTransimission, localCasesResidingInDorms, localCasesNotResidinginDorms)
}


val records:Dataset[Record] = df.map( parse )

paragraphs.text:
%md 

### Note

`import spark.implicits._` is having a scope of a Zeppelin cell. We have to import it whenever we declare a new schema / case clsas.

msg.data:

import spark.implicits._ is having a scope of a Zeppelin cell. We have to import it whenever we declare a new schema / case clsas.

paragraphs.text:
%md 

Spark Dataset has similar set of APIs as Dataframe's, such as `select`, `groupBy` and `show`.

msg.data: Spark Dataset has similar set of APIs as Dataframe’s, such as select, groupBy and show.

paragraphs.text: records.show(5)

%md 
Note that all these operations return a dataframe instead of a dataset

msg.data: Note that all these operations return a dataframe instead of a dataset

Without any surprise, SQL query is also supported.

paragraphs.text:
%md 


## User Defined Function (UDF)


UDF for dataset comes almost for free thanks to the `.map()`, `filter()` and `groupByKey()`.

msg.data:
User Defined Function (UDF)

UDF for dataset comes almost for free thanks to the .map(), filter() and groupByKey().

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Filter

msg.data: Filter

paragraphs.text: records.filter( r => r.dailyDeaths > 0).show()

%md 
### Map

msg.data: Map

paragraphs.text:
%md 

### GroupByKey

msg.data: GroupByKey

paragraphs.text:
import spark.implicits._

case class MonthlyNewCases(month:Int, newCases:Int)

val grouped: KeyValueGroupedDataset[Int,Record] = records.groupByKey((r:Record) => r.date.getMonth)

val monthlynewCases: Dataset[MonthlyNewCases] = grouped.mapGroups((key:Int,records:Iterator[Record]) => MonthlyNewCases(key+1, records.map(r=>r.dailyConfirmed).sum))

monthlynewCases.orderBy(col("month")).show()
